items.summary: Ashley Gordon grew up in the Victorian coal mining town of Morwell and went on to become a doctor before he was murdered.

items.title: Submarine tour, roof protest and shark encounter feature in our top WA photos for November
items.summary: Our photographers cast their eyes towards WA's exploding rabbit population, a surfer's near-miss with a suspected great white shark, and a school program helping parents bond with their children.

items.title: Statistically, it's impossible to predict domestic violence homicide. That doesn't mean we should give up
items.summary: Victims must always be believed. The uncomfortable truth, however, is that statistically, it is almost impossible to predict lethal family violence because it is so rare.

items.title: Supreme Court proceeding starts in Broome over alleged murder
items.summary: Ian Ralph Brooke has been found unfit to stand trial for murder, with a special proceedings hearing underway.

items.title: How Wiradjuri constellations like the Great Celestial Emu make us look at the sky in a different way
items.summary: All 88 internationally recognised constellations have European origins. But First Nations astronomy tells older, beautiful stories that contain invaluable lessons and knowledge.

items.title: Matildas coach Joe Montemurro calls out Australian football's 'inferiority complex' in passionate plea
items.summary: Joe Montemurro echoes the words of former Matildas boss Alen Stajcic in offering a frank review of the culture surrounding the world game in Australia.

items.title: Princess Aiko's popularity sparks calls to ditch male-only succession law in Japan
items.summary: Historically, Japan has had numerous women monarchs. But current laws prevent the emperor's daughter from succeeding him — and politicians, including the prime minister, support the status quo.

items.title: Allegations of sexual misconduct levelled at father-son Bowen therapists in Ballarat
items.summary: Five women allege sexual misconduct against a Ballarat Bowen therapy business run by a father-son duo.

items.title: Scathing 'jobs for mates' review finds government appointments too often look like 'nepotism'
items.summary: A report into government appointments to boards savages the system, which it says too often allows governments to award friends or pick candidates for political purposes, eroding trust with the public.

items.title: ASX edges higher, Bitcoin dives, government releases its National AI Plan - as it happened
items.summary: The ASX edged higher, while the federal government released its National AI Plan. Catch up on the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

items.title: South Australian farmers fear future as bird flu recovery causes egg oversupply
items.summary: The industry was plagued by bird flu 12 months ago, but some producers are now struggling to sell their product due to a faster-than-expected recovery.

items.title: White House says Hegseth authorised admiral to strike alleged drug boat
items.summary: US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth authorised an admiral to conduct multiple strikes that killed 11 people on a vessel from Venezuela allegedly carrying illegal narcotics in September.

items.title: Filmmaker breaks decades of silence over Yolŋu clan leader's alleged murder by police
items.summary: Acclaimed filmmaker George Gittoes has revealed a former NT police officer told him he witnessed his colleagues taking a Yolŋu clan leader out to shoot him and dump his body in Darwin Harbour in 1934.

items.title: Andrew Lethlean undecided on whether to challenge Jacinta Allan in Bendigo East
items.summary: Nationals favourite Andrew Lethlean is tight-lipped on whether he will challenge Premier Jacinta Allan in Bendigo East next year.

items.title: As teacher shortages loom across Australia these Queensland schools are trialling solutions
items.summary: As staff shortages "near crisis point", these Queensland schools are going to extraordinary lengths to put teachers in classrooms — and keep them there.

items.title: Why you should read the fine print when purchasing a gift card this festive season
items.summary: If you receive a gift card for Christmas this year you might fall foul of "activation rules". Here's how.

items.title: Artificial intelligence to be managed through existing laws under National AI Plan
items.summary: The federal government's long-awaited National AI Plan will seek to accelerate the growth of artificial intelligence in Australia, and largely leverage existing laws to protect against its worst harms.

items.title: The numbers and narrative behind Australia's staggering pink ball success
items.summary: Day-night Test cricket provides Australia with one of the most potent home advantages in the history of the sport. Ten years into its existence, these are the numbers behind the format, its best performers and the ways England could spring an upset in Brisbane.

items.title: NDIS cuts Deaf man's Auslan funding, recommends he explore 'other communication methods'
items.summary: Disability advocates say cuts to Deaf participants' NDIS funding is a "systemic" problem that reflects a belief that Deafness can be "fixed".

items.title: Tumbling Bitcoin's last useful business — money laundering — under threat from Tether
items.summary: It remains a useful tool for some nefarious operators, including global crime gangs and questionable governments, but Bitcoin's role has been usurped by stablecoins — one in particular.

items.title: Is social media masking bushwalking dangers and leading to poor hiking decisions?
items.summary: There are concerns that social media is leading to poor bushwalking decisions with trends such as "rawdogging" a hike glorifying a lack of preparedness.

items.title: Woolworths accused of exploiting affordable housing schemes to push new developments
items.summary: The retail giant is using development fast-track schemes to push ahead with new supermarket and apartment projects opposed by local councils.

items.title: Tasmanians express mix of views ahead of final Macquarie Point stadium vote
items.summary: By the end of this week, Tasmania will know whether or not Hobart will have a new AFL stadium. Many Tasmanians are still making up their own minds about whether they support it or not.

items.title: Pablo Escobar's final mistake and the lonely death of the cocaine king
items.summary: More than three decades since his death in a rooftop shootout with police, the legacy of cocaine king Pablo Escobar continues to affect Colombia.

items.title: One fire, two systems: Hong Kong's grief meets Beijing's red lines
items.summary: The blaze that consumed Wang Fuk Court burned for two days, but its political shock waves may echo for weeks, even months.

items.title: Flooding in Indonesia, Thailand and Sri Lanka kills more than 1,160 people as recovery efforts continue
items.summary: Indonesia, Thailand and Sri Lanka are reeling from flooding that has killed hundreds in each country and destroyed communities.

items.title: World Health Organization recommends Ozempic-style medications as long-term obesity treatments
items.summary: Ozempic-style medications have been recommended as long-term treatments for obesity under new guidelines released by the World Health Organization.

items.title: Think tank says an overlooked solution to Australia's housing crisis could unlock about 1 million new homes
items.summary: The public policy think tank, CEDA, believes Australia could increase its current housing stock by nine per cent if just one in four standalone homes in the five biggest cities are developed into dual occupancies.

items.title: WACA seeks total exemption from paying council rates until 2035, costing up to $2.5 million
items.summary: The Western Australian Cricket Association has asked the City of Perth for a 10-year exemption from paying any rates. If granted it would potentially cost the city $2.5 million in revenue.

items.title: Sam Kerr edges closer to injury return in final Matildas friendly vs New Zealand before Asian Cup
items.summary: Matildas captain Sam Kerr is running out of chances to make her long-awaited return from a knee injury, as the Australian team faces New Zealand's Football Ferns in their last scheduled match before next year's Asian Cup.

items.title: Prosecutors call last witnesses in trial of Rajwinder Singh, accused of murdering Toyah Cordingley
items.summary: The jury in the former Innisfail nurse's murder trial has heard more than three weeks of evidence.

items.title: Businesses using 'branded identifiers' in SMS messages now need to register them
items.summary: Organisations using branded identifiers in their text messages to consumers will need to register them by July 1, 2026, or risk being mistaken for a scam.

items.title: Monday Finance with Alan Kohler
items.summary: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

items.title: First day of summer delivers record heat in the west, record cold in the east
items.summary: Summer has arrived in Australia with a bang, with fire and searing heat in the west, while a sprinkling of snow accompanied record cold temperatures in the south-east of the country.

items.title: NSW government, energy company under fire after native bird habitat cleared for renewables project
items.summary: The NSW government's flagship renewable energy project has come under fire after trees containing dozens of hatchlings were cut down.

items.title: Watchdog updates warnings for Ozempic-style drugs over potential risk of suicidal thoughts
items.summary: Australia's medicines regulator issues a safety warning over the potential risk of suicidal thoughts and behaviours when taking Ozempic-style drugs.

items.title: Luxury caravan manufacturer Zone RV collapses into administration
items.summary: Hundreds of Zone RV employees are out of work weeks before Christmas after arriving at work on Monday morning and being told the bad news.

items.title: $3.4 billion Coomera Connector stage one to open after construction cracks probed
items.summary: Motorists will be able to use the first 4-kilometre stretch of the new Coomera Connector as an alternative to the busy Pacific Motorway from Tuesday.

items.title: Popular and easy summer desserts
items.summary: Summer desserts are for sharing and we have 10 options for end-of-year gatherings and Christmas.

items.title: Government unveils Department of Defence overhaul amid delays and cost blowouts
items.summary: Three groups within Defence will be rolled into one entity as part of a sweeping restructure of the department.

items.title: Ngangkaṟi share traditional healing in new edition of book that went global
items.summary: The Ngangkaṟi in Central Australia use traditional healing techniques to draw out illness with their hands. A new edition of their book aims to share this knowledge Western health workers.

items.title: How councils are preparing for billion-dollar wind farm projects amid renewables boom
items.summary: As approvals for multi-billion-dollar projects land on agendas at country local government meetings, staff and elected representatives battle to ensure their communities are prepared to benefit.

items.title: Emerson Jones and James Duckworth receive wildcards ahead of 2026 Australian Open
items.summary: Teen star Emerson Jones becomes one of the youngest Australians to receive a wildcard to the Australian Open after stellar performances at tournaments in November.

items.title: Sensitive parliament communications handed to contractor without security clearance
items.summary: The team of a contractor that was the victim of a Russia-linked hack did not have the necessary security clearance when it received thousands of sensitive communications between politicians and parliamentary staff, in a mistake the department has now conceded.

items.title: Meningococcal B scare prompts call for free immunisation program
items.summary: Charlie was in a coma for days after contracting the rare but preventable disease. He was lucky to survive.

items.title: Gold Coast warned it faces traffic gridlock without major shift to public transport
items.summary: With the population heading toward 1 million, the Gold Coast is being urged to overhaul its transport system or risk becoming defined by traffic.

items.title: Christmas Island's last dog embraced by the remote community
items.summary: Dogs were banned some years ago to protect the unique wildlife of Christmas Island, but one very special chocolate Labrador remains, and she is shared by the whole community.

items.title: Energy grid not ready for Eraring coal plant's closure, AEMO says
items.summary: The energy grid is not ready for the closure of the Eraring coal plant, the energy operator has warned, raising the threat of widespread blackouts in eastern Australia.

items.title: Rubio says Ukraine talks in US productive but work remains to find peace deal
items.summary: Marco Rubio says he expects the talks between US and Ukrainian officials on Sunday about finding a peace deal with Russia to yield progress in ending the war.

items.title: Eight ways to drink less during Christmas party season
items.summary: If you want to drink less (or not at all) this silly season, you don't have to rely on willpower alone. Having a plan can help.

items.title: Opticomm customers across Australia losing free-to-air television and facing internet outages
items.summary: About 50,000 Australians are set to lose access to free-to-air television using their existing technology. And the troubles do not end there, with many customers also reporting regular and prolonged internet outages.

items.title: Thousands of Australians losing free-to-air tv access and facing internet outages
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: Big haul of 170yo Indigenous artefacts unearthed in North West Queensland
items.summary: A stash of Aboriginal artefacts, dating back about 170 years, is unearthed from the red dirt of outback Queensland, bringing history to life for the local Pitta Pitta people.

items.title: Australia humbled by New Zealand in Dubai rugby sevens finals
items.summary: Australia falls to its trans-Tasman rivals in both the women's and men's finals at the season-opening leg of the world series.

items.title: ASX outage stops trade in dozens of shares, market slides on Metcash, AUB and CSL
items.summary: Professional investors slam another "embarrassing" ASX technical glitch, which saw trading halted in around 50 stocks as companies were unable to publish price-sensitive announcements.

items.title: The Macquarie Point stadium decision is due this week — here's how it could play out
items.summary: The long-running debate over whether an AFL stadium should be built on Hobart's waterfront is reaching an end, as the parliamentary vote takes place this week.

items.title: Australia's Travis Head prepared to play any role in day-night Ashes Test against England
items.summary: Travis Head says he has no qualms if he is shifted back down Australia's batting order following his exploits as an opener in the first Ashes Test.

items.title: Complaints to council climb as Brisbane residents deal with stormwater runoff. But whose responsibility is it?
items.summary: Runoff from heavy rainfall and poor drainage can cause damage to properties and worsen flooding. So, who's responsible if your property experiences runoff, and what can you do about it?

items.title: Lebanese hopeful Pope Leo will bring peace as he visits the country
items.summary: As Pope Leo visits Lebanon, many locals hope he will bring peace to the region, viewing the visit as a message of solidarity.

items.title: Hinchinbrook by-election a tick of approval for LNP government but no crystal ball for outcome of next election
items.summary: A week is a long time in politics, let alone three years, and the LNP's success at the next election is by no means assured, writes Jack McKay.

items.title: Dicky Bill salad farms enter administration with 180 job cuts before Christmas
items.summary: Australian salad grower Dicky Bill enters administration, putting 180 people out of work before Christmas.

items.title: Italian-Australian glass artist takes her work from Carnarvon to Venice
items.summary: Sabrina's father warned her she couldn't make a living from art, but after decades in a sensible job she's now making waves in the world of glass art.
